Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Cardiovascular Effects of Oxytocin and Carbetocin during Cesarean Section

Trial_Design.evidence: Seventy healthy pregnant women at term (37-41 weeks) were enrolled and randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: Seventy healthy pregnant women at term (37-41 weeks) were enrolled

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either 5 IU of intravenous oxytocin (OXY group, n=34) or 100 µg of intravenous carbetocin (CARBE group, n=36)

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial aimed to evaluate the cardiovascular effects of oxytocin and carbetocin

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of ST-segment changes, measured intraoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was based on the day of the month, and allocation was not concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not implemented for patients or clinicians

Number_Randomised.evidence: OXY group, n=34 or 100 µg of intravenous carbetocin (CARBE group, n=36)

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on a per-protocol basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: The effect size for ST-segment changes was not significant (p > 0.05)

Harms.evidence: No adverse cardiovascular events were reported in either group
